abstract.p: Dublin-based Independent News and Media secures approval from Britain's trade secretary to proceed with its acquisition of The Belfast Telegraph from British-based Mirror Group for 300 million pounds ($448 million); Independent News, which is run by Anthony J F O'Reilly, owns 28.5 percent of newspaper market in Northern Ireland and controls most of national daily newspaper readership in Republic of Ireland; photo (S)

block.p: An international media conglomerate based in Dublin, Independent News and Media, secured approval from Britain's trade secretary to proceed with its acquisition of The Belfast Telegraph from the British-based Mirror Group for $:300 million ($448 million). Irish authorities had already approved the deal. Independent News and Media, which is run by the former head of H. J. Heinz, Anthony J. F. O'Reilly, above, now owns 28.5 percent of the newspaper market in Northern Ireland and controls most of the national daily newspaper readership in the Republic of Ireland.

WORLD BUSINESS BRIEFING: EUROPE Correction: July 20, 2000, Thursday Two pictures in the World Business Briefing column of Business Day yesterday with separate reports from Ireland were reversed. The first showed Anthony J. F. O'Reilly, who runs Independent News and Media, which received approval to proceed with its acquisition of The Belfast Telegraph. The second showed Prime Minister Bertie Ahern, who instructed cabinet members to ask industry leaders to avoid unnecessary price increases.
